intro: Sarcomphalus, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Melanthiaceae. It consists of several species that are native to various regions in the Northern Hemisphere, primarily in temperate climates. Sarcomphalus species are generally herbaceous perennials, though some may exhibit semi-woody characteristics.
